column1: # These readings were taken at the top of Boston Stump, about 260 ft above ground level,
# as part of a series of experiments to compare the amount of rainfall collected well above ground level.
# An article in British Rainfall 1880 discusses the results.
# As the readings differ so much from standard ground level readings, they should not be used for other purposes!
# Readings for September - December 1880 are grouped into a single aggregate reading of 7.03 on the sheet.
